TITLE: Can China Fight Deflation and Trump’s Tariffs at the Same Time?
SUMMARY: China is facing a double whammy: corrosive deflation and tariffs that threaten to block trade. Chinese workers will be the biggest casualties.

TITLE: Powell Warns Trump Tariffs Could Trigger Higher Inflation and Slower Growth
SUMMARY: Jerome H. Powell warned that President Trump’s tariffs could lead to a “challenging scenario” for the central bank.

TITLE: Maryland Mental Hospital With Painful History to Rebuild
SUMMARY: The former Hospital for the Negro Insane of Maryland was once the state’s most crowded psychiatric institution. Pulling off a plan to redevelop it won’t be easy.

TITLE: Trump Administration Aims to Sell Housing Department Headquarters
SUMMARY: The building has been added to a list of properties that the administration says it is trying to offload in order to eliminate waste.

TITLE: LVMH’s Chief Counted Trump as a Friend. He Still Faces Tariffs.
SUMMARY: The trade war has hurt the Louis Vuitton Moët Hennessy luxury empire. Bernard Arnault, head of the company, said a failure to strike a deal with President Trump would be “the fault of Brussels.”

TITLE: Meloni Meets With Trump, With Tariffs on the Agenda
SUMMARY: Giorgia Meloni has come to the White House representing Italy, but in many ways on behalf of the rest of Europe.

TITLE: Google Is Illegally Monopolizing Online Advertising Tech, Judge Rules
SUMMARY: The judge ruled that Google monopolized the market for two of three sets of products. It was the second time in a year that a U.S. court found it had acted illegally to remain dominant.

TITLE: White House Eyes Overhaul of Federal Housing Aid to the Poor
SUMMARY: The Trump administration has considered sharply curtailing vouchers as part of its budget for the 2026 fiscal year.

TITLE: LVMH Names Jonathan Anderson as Dior Men’s Artistic Director
SUMMARY: A one-sentence statement served as the notice that Mr. Anderson, who reimagined LVMH’s Loewe brand, would lead men’s wear design at Dior.

TITLE: IMF Warns Trump Tariffs Will Weaken Economy and Increase Inflation
SUMMARY: Kristalina Georgieva, the managing director of the International Monetary Fund, warned in a speech that protectionism erodes productivity.

TITLE: E.C.B. Cuts Rates Amid Uncertainty Over Trump’s Tariffs
SUMMARY: Policymakers lowered rates a quarter point and said that the region’s growth outlook had “deteriorated” because of rising trade tensions.

TITLE: Why Does Harvard Have Tax-Exempt Status and Can the IRS Revoke It? What to Know.
SUMMARY: The university, like many colleges and charities, is exempt from property and federal income taxes, saving it billions of dollars. President Trump has questioned whether it should enjoy that status.

TITLE: Trump Says Fed Chair Jerome Powell’s ‘Termination Cannot Come Fast Enough’
SUMMARY: Jerome Powell has said that the Federal Reserve can be patient as the effects of tariffs become more clear. President Trump, pushing for interest rate cuts, said, “Powell’s termination cannot come fast enough!”

TITLE: Powell Faces Pressure From the Markets and Trump Over Rates
SUMMARY: The Fed chair signaled the central bank will stand pat on borrowing costs despite President Trump’s trade fight. Investors and the president aren’t happy.

TITLE: Nvidia C.E.O. Meets With Chinese Trade Officials in Beijing
SUMMARY: The day before the visit by Jensen Huang, lawmakers in Washington said they were investigating whether the chipmaker’s sales in China violated U.S. rules.

TITLE: Daily Pill May Work as Well as Ozempic for Weight Loss and Blood Sugar
SUMMARY: Eli Lilly said clinical results of its GLP-1 in pill form showed safety and efficacy data similar to blockbuster injectable drugs.

TITLE: A Cheapskate in London: Travel on a Budget
SUMMARY: Our Frugal Travel columnist took a budget-stretching, four-day trip to one of the world’s most expensive cities. Would chasing bargains lessen, or enhance, her experience?

TITLE: I.R.S. Is Said to Be Considering Whether to Revoke Harvard’s Tax-Exempt Status
SUMMARY: The move would be a major escalation of the Trump administration’s attempts to choke off federal money and support for the leading research university.

TITLE: Finding 314 Things the Government Might Know About You
SUMMARY: Two reporters spent over a month compiling and analyzing information about the reams of data the U.S. government collects about Americans.

TITLE: Trump Joins Japan Trade Talks, Says ‘Big Progress’ Made
SUMMARY: For his first face-to-face talks on tariffs, the president chose Japan, a U.S. ally that decades ago stirred his anger over the unequal balance of trade and his penchant for tariffs.

TITLE: Court Scraps $8 Limit on Credit Card Late Fees
SUMMARY: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau switched sides and backed a federal lawsuit by banks and business groups seeking to eliminate a fee cap the bureau set last year.

TITLE: Trump’s 10% Tariff May Be Less Onerous but Still Raises Prices and Threatens Trade
SUMMARY: The blanket tariffs, once considered extreme, still threaten to harm world trade and make everything more expensive for businesses and consumers.

TITLE: How China Took Over the World’s Rare Earths Industry
SUMMARY: China seized mines and built factories. Japan took note and invested in Australia. But the United States did little despite concerns about control of supplies.

TITLE: Shein and Temu Will be Hit by Trump’s China Tariffs. Americans Are Worried.
SUMMARY: The Trump administration’s plan to add steep fees to packages from China will deal a blow to Temu, Shein and some TikTok Shop sellers, worrying American consumers.

TITLE: Taiwan’s Chip Companies Are Caught in the U.S.-China Tariff War
SUMMARY: President Trump has threatened tariffs on Taiwan and the chip industry. China has signaled it will not let the trade war keep it from the technology it needs.

TITLE: China Girds for Economic Stress of Trump’s Tariffs
SUMMARY: The economy grew steadily from January through March, but U.S. tariffs pose a risk for China in the coming weeks and months.

TITLE: In ‘Your Friends & Neighbors,’ the Watches Steal the Show
SUMMARY: “Your Friends & Neighbors” strives to comment on the vacuousness of wealth while simultaneously glorifying the spoils of being really, really rich.

TITLE: Patients Cut Off From Cheaper Obesity Drugs as FDA Halts Sales of Copycats
SUMMARY: U.S. regulators are trying to shut down the industry for compounded weight-loss drugs, which could result in higher costs or suspend treatment for patients.

TITLE: Unions Form Pro Bono Legal Network for Federal Workers Targeted by Trump
SUMMARY: Organized labor has taken a leading role in challenging the Trump administration’s downsizing agenda in court. A new service will offer more individualized representation.

TITLE: Nvidia and Other Chip Giants Are Caught in Trade War Crossfire
SUMMARY: Nvidia and others are the latest casualties of escalating tensions between Washington and Beijing, as analysts press business leaders about the tariffs fallout.

TITLE: Tariff Confusion and Recession Fears Leave Advertisers ‘Paralyzed’
SUMMARY: Hundreds of billions of marketing dollars are in flux as companies struggle to plan. For some sectors, the timing “couldn’t be worse.”

TITLE: A Reporter on Steak Fries: Tasty Spud or Dud?
SUMMARY: A culinary mystery and a change in perspective on the classic dish.

TITLE: Stocks Fall on Jerome Powell’s Concern About Tariffs and Tech’s Pullback
SUMMARY: Semiconductor stocks fell after the Trump administration blocked companies from selling certain chips to China without a license.

TITLE: Hong Kong Suspends Packages to the U.S., Wading Into the Trump Trade War
SUMMARY: The move comes before President Trump’s planned imposition of new tariffs on small packages sent to the United States from Hong Kong and China.

TITLE: White House Ends a Regular Reporting Slot for Independent Newswires
SUMMARY: The move, which affects The Associated Press, Bloomberg News and Reuters, is another effort by the Trump administration to exert more control over the press corps that covers it.

TITLE: Trump Seeks to Lower Drug Prices Through Medicare and Some Imports
SUMMARY: President Trump directed his administration to help states import drugs from Canada. But a proposal to alter a Medicare program to reduce costs could wind up raising prices.

TITLE: ‘Human Made’: Artists Push Back on A.I. Dolls and Action Figures
SUMMARY: Amid the rush to take part in a recent trend, some artists, concerned about the use of ChatGPT, are hand-drawing their own versions.

TITLE: Sarah Palin’s Libel Trial Against The New York Times Begins
SUMMARY: In opening statements, lawyers for Sarah Palin and The Times each presented arguments on whether the editorial board had published a statement knowing it was false.

TITLE: American Airlines Will Offer Free Wi-Fi on Most Flights Next Year
SUMMARY: Starting in January, members of the airline’s AAdvantage loyalty program will have free access to wireless internet on 90 percent of its fleet, the company said.

TITLE: Some Online Scam Victims Can Now Seek Tax Relief on Firmer Ground
SUMMARY: The Internal Revenue Service issued a memo last month that said victims of certain impersonation and investment schemes might be eligible for a tax break.

TITLE: Why Antitrust Breakups of Google and Meta Could Be Difficult
SUMMARY: For the first time since the late 1990s Microsoft case, federal trials are weighing antitrust breakups, a tactic that harks back to Standard Oil.

TITLE: Marvin Levy, Oscar-Winning Publicist to Spielberg, Dies at 96
SUMMARY: For 42 years, Mr. Levy strategized behind the scenes to promote Steven Spielberg’s movies and ensure that the director was seen as Hollywood’s de facto head of state.

TITLE: Trump’s Tariff Threat for Drug imports Poses Big Political Risks
SUMMARY: Levies on Americans’ daily prescriptions and other medicines could raise costs, spur rationing and lead to shortages of critical drugs.

TITLE: S&P 500 and Nasdaq Stocks Post Modest Gains Amid Trump Tariff Uncertainty
SUMMARY: The Trump administration’s chaotic tariff rollout continues to spur volatility in the markets, but major U.S. stock indexes held a degree of calm relative to recent swings.

TITLE: Trump’s Give-and-Take Tariff Strategy
SUMMARY: The president has watered down some of his trade demands, but that’s created confusion in the markets and has forced his administration to adapt its messaging.

TITLE: Trump and DOGE Are Planning Deregulation at a Massive Scale
SUMMARY: The White House will soon move to rapidly repeal or freeze rules that affect health, food, workplace safety, transportation and more.

TITLE: A Scientist Is Paid to Study Maple Syrup. He’s Also Paid to Promote It.
SUMMARY: Funded by the maple industry, a researcher has exaggerated his findings to suggest that syrup could help prevent serious diseases.

TITLE: Trump’s Trade War With China Could Be Good for India. But Is It Ready?
SUMMARY: While India dreams of becoming a new factory to the world, its manufacturers are struggling to find skilled workers, secure components and overcome red tape.

TITLE: Trump’s Dilemma: A Trade War That Threatens Every Other Negotiation With China
SUMMARY: President Trump is staking everything on winning by imposing tariffs on China. But the fight threatens to choke off negotiations about other issues like Taiwan, fentanyl, TikTok and more.

TITLE: China’s Halt of Critical Minerals Poses Risk for U.S. Military Programs
SUMMARY: The Pentagon and defense contractors are heavily reliant on magnets and rare earth minerals mined or processed in China, which has suspended exports of the materials in an escalating trade war.

TITLE: White House to Ask Congress to Rescind $1.1 Billion From NPR and PBS
SUMMARY: Trump administration officials want legislators to rescind $1.1 billion for the Corporation for Public Broadcasting, which provides some support for public media.

TITLE: US Dollar Keeps Falling as Trump’s Tariffs Rattle Investors
SUMMARY: President Trump’s tariff blitz has rattled investors and shaken their faith in one of the most reliable and ubiquitous assets in the world economy.

TITLE: Marjorie Taylor Greene Bought Market Dip Before Trump Paused Tariffs, Profiting From the Rally
SUMMARY: The Georgia congresswoman purchased at least tens of thousands of dollars in stock the day before and the day of President Trump’s pause of a sweeping set of tariffs that sent the market soaring.

TITLE: Mark Zuckerberg Is Back in the Hot Seat in a Crucial Trial
SUMMARY: Mark Zuckerberg has appeared before Congress more times than any other tech leader. He will testify again soon — as a witness in a federal antitrust trial. Cecilia Kang, a technology reporter for The New York Times, recalls some of Zuckerberg’s past congressional hearings and explains why the stakes are even higher this time.

TITLE: Goldman Sachs Avoids Mentioning the Word ‘Tariffs’ Amid Trump Trade Policy Uncertainty
SUMMARY: Wall Street’s top firms have been reluctant to criticize President Trump’s trade policy, but Goldman took it to a new level on Monday.

TITLE: The Colorful Cult of Le Creuset
SUMMARY: The weighty cookware, which just turned 100, has inspired generations of home chefs and fans who feverishly hunt for their favorite shapes and shades.

TITLE: Trump Moves to Put New Tariffs on Computer Chips and Drugs
SUMMARY: Citing a national security statute, the administration has begun a process to investigate the impact of imported semiconductors and pharmaceuticals.

TITLE: Lego Black Market Fetches Big Prices and Fuels Brazen Thefts
SUMMARY: Some Lego sets have skyrocketed in value but behind the eye-popping price tags is a dark side: an underground market that fuels brazen thefts.
